business.headline: Why India's growing wealth is driving investment into luxury real estateAs capital increases, investors become more careful. The focus shifts from chasing returns to protecting value. This is why luxury real estate is gaining importance in serious portfolios.

Silver jumps over Rs 8,000: Time to invest, hold or sell?Silver shot up by over Rs 8,000, marking a fresh high in recent trading. With momentum high but volatility looming, the big question is: is it time to invest or sell?

What are Life Cycle Funds and how can they make your retirement planning easier?Life cycle funds are designed to adjust their asset allocation automatically as an investor moves closer to a specific goal, usually retirement.

Sensex tumbles 600 points: Why is stock market falling todayAt 1 PM, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 635.88 points at 81,612.73. The NSE Nifty50 fell 217.75 points to 25,278.80. Both indices were down nearly 1%.

Block's 4,000 job cuts: Why layoffs are no longer a sign of crisisBlock said it would cut more than 4,000 jobs, nearly half its workforce, reducing staff from over 10,000 to just under 6,000. This was not a company in distress. It was a company growing.
Sensex opens 277 points lower, Nifty below 25,400; Infosys up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 389.29 points to 81,866.32, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 154.55 points to 25,342.00 as of 9:50 am.

Rs 583 crore returned, full-page ads out – is IDFC First Bank's trust push enough?IDFC First Bank's response offers a rare test of corporate accountability. But will a quick refund and bold messaging be enough to turn a damaging crisis into a chance to rebuild trust? We spoke to experts to understand what real recovery will demand.

Netflix calls Warner deal not attractive, clears path for ParamountNetflix declined to raise its bid for Warner Bros. Discovery, clearing the way for Paramount's $31-per-share takeover offer that could reshape Hollywood and trigger major antitrust scrutiny.

Earning Rs 30 lakh a year but little wealth? Why many DINK couples fall behindWith two salaries and no childcare costs, DINK couples are often seen as having a clear financial advantage. Yet many high-earning couples find their wealth growing slower than expected. Is lifestyle inflation quietly eroding their investment potential?

India, Israel sign MoU to link UPI systems, boost digital payment tiesThe integration is expected to help Indian and Israeli businesses and individuals carry out financial transactions more easily. It could also reduce transaction costs and processing time, making payments faster and more convenient.

World Economic Forum chief Borge Brende quits amid probe into Epstein tiesBorge Brende, President and CEO of the World Economic Forum, has stepped down amid scrutiny over his past interactions with Jeffrey Epstein.
Sensex and Nifty erase early gains to end flat over global uncertaintyThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 27.46 points to close at 82,248.61, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 14.05 points to end at 25,496.55.

MeitY Secretary S Krishnan says social media must work within constitutional limitsS Krishnan defended the government's approach to regulating digital platforms. He said the Ministry's actions are firmly rooted in the Constitution and follow due legal process.

Gold jumped 72% and silver soared 122% last year. Can 2026 deliver the same rally?Gold and silver may not climb the way they did in 2025, but the base remains firm. This year calls for clear judgement, realistic expectations and a focus on long-term signals.

Government mandates 20% ethanol-blended petrol with RON 95 from April 1In a notification issued on February 17, the Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas directed oil marketing companies to supply ethanol-blended petrol, also called E20 petrol, across all states and Union Territories.

8th Pay Commission progresses: Salary and pension on the rise?Among the main demands are a higher fitment factor, bigger annual increments, improved retirement benefits and changes in pension and promotion policies.

Gold dips, silver slips: Should you buy now?After recent gains, gold and silver prices have slipped marginally. While the fall is small, many buyers and investors are now wondering if this correction offers a chance to buy.

The Rs 1 crore question: Should you invest in stocks or buy a home?For India's middle class, owning a home is not just a financial goal. It is security. It is respect. It is stability for the family. Many parents believe a rented house means uncertainty, while a home of your own means safety.

Property deals under Rs 20 lakh? PAN may not be needed from April 1At present, PAN must be quoted when buying or selling immovable property, such as a house, flat, or plot, if the transaction value exceeds Rs 10 lakh.

Deepinder Goyal wins EY Entrepreneur Of The Year 2025 awardDeepinder Goyal was recognised for his focus on innovation, strong operations and long-term thinking. The jury also noted that his businesses have created thousands of jobs for youth and gig workers and supported a wider ecosystem of entrepreneurs across the country.

entertainment.headline: Guruji never called him disciple: Ravi Shankar Centre on sitarist Rishab's claims The Ravi Shankar Centre issued an official statement, while reacting to the claims about sitarist Rishab Rikhiram Sharma being a disciple of Pandit Ravi Shankar.

Thadayam review: Samuthirakani's thriller has promise but settles for the obviousRelease Date:Fri Feb 27, 2026 Thadayam review: Director Navinkumar Palanivel's show Thadayam, starring Samuthirakani, Sshivada Nair and Raj Tirandas, is a murder mystery about two serial killers in the mid-90s. The six-episode show falls short of brilliance as it relies on shock values and cliches.

Accused review: Konkona-Pratibha Rannta's restrained drama may test your patienceRelease Date:Fri Feb 27, 2026 Netflix's Hindi psychological thriller Accused follows a queer gynaecologist in London as her life unravels after disturbing allegations. While the premise offers a fresh take on workplace politics and social scrutiny, the slow burn and uneven performances keep it from making a lasting impact.

All my love: Sonam Kapoor posts warm birthday wish for mother-in-law Priya Ahuja Sonam Kapoor marked her mother-in-law Priya Ahuja's birthday with a warm and heartfelt note, expressing gratitude for her kindness and calling herself fortunate to have her in their lives.

Bridgerton grows up with Season 4: A modern love story draped in regency silk With Part 2 of Bridgerton Season 4 out now, the series trades fairytale fantasy for dignity, grief and real emotional negotiation. Benedict and Sophie's class-defying romance is not the only good thing about it.

Scream 7 review: Neve Campbell's Sidney Prescott deserves a sharper scriptRelease Date:Fri Feb 27, 2026 Scream 7 movie review: Scream 7 brings back Neve Campbell's Sidney Prescott in a familiar horror setting. The film blends legacy trauma with digital fears but falls short on narrative depth and innovation.

Kit Harington compares Industry to GoT: Both are full of pretty horrific people Actor Kit Harington draws parallels between Game of Thrones and Industry, focusing on their morally complex characters. The latest season of Industry delves into high finance's ruthless world, highlighting privilege and ambition.

Daisy Shah freezes her eggs, says she wants motherhood on her own terms Actor Daisy Shah shared her views on marriage and motherhood. She revealed freezing her eggs and cautious approach towards marriage influenced by recent relationship news.

Charak vs censors: Producer Sudipto Sen says art shouldn't be restricted Filmmaker Sudipto Sen's upcoming film Charak faces censorship challenges, but he firmly believes art should not be restricted. He trusts the maturity of Indian audiences.

Ismail Darbar thinks Arijit's playback singing retirement is brave and intelligent Ismail Darbar spoke about Arijit Singh's recent retirement from playback singing. He described the move as both brave and intelligent, and expressed regret at not being able to collaborate with the singer.

Steady breaths, welled-up eyes: Lokah star Kalyani on special Virosh moment Actor Kalyani Priyadarshan shared a moving moment from Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda's Udaipur wedding, and her words are hard to ignore.

When Rashmika-Vijay invited Amit Shah for their wedding. Check viral pics Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna extended a formal wedding invitation and a silver Ganesh idol to Home Minister Amit Shah. The meeting happened days before their Udaipur wedding.

P!nk slams split rumours with husband Carey Hart, calls it fake news Singer P!nk refuted reports of separation from her husband Carey Hart, labelling the claims as "fake news" on social media and urged attention towards more significant matters.

Allu Sirish to host pre-wedding bash for industry friends on March 2. Details Allu Sirish shared a post on X and informed that the family is set to host their pre-wedding bash on March 2. The actor will marry Nayanika Reddy on March 6.

Vir Das says his new show is an 'ode to the stranger.' Read why Comedian Vir Das opens up on his journey as an immigrant in the US, AI, and need for imperfection in art, as he gears up for his Hey Stranger US Tour

Dhadak 2 screens at Brown, Yale; Karan Johar shares pride Karan Johar's 2025 production Dhadak 2, starring Siddhant Chaturvedi and Triptii Dimri, has found an academic audience overseas with special screenings at Brown University and Yale University. The producer shared his excitement on social media.

Charak trailer: Sudipto Sen film promises a haunting look at superstitious rituals Sudipto Sen-backed folklore thriller Charak: Fair of Faith is about occult rituals. The film aims to explore the repercussions of radical fanaticism.

Kerala Story 2 makers' fierce fight against halt on release, but no court relief The makers of The Kerala Story 2 challenged the single judge order halting the film's release, contending that India should not be so fragile that a movie can threaten a religion. They also added that films have previously depicted Hindu gods and goddesses in a satirical light without similar restrictions.

The man who taught me true love: Rashmika's emotional note for Vijay Rashmika Mandanna dedicated an emotional note to her actor-husband Vijay Deverakonda, sharing first pics from their wedding. She thanked Vijay for teaching her what 'true love' and 'peace' actually mean.

general news.headline: Economically illiterate: CBI faces Delhi court ire over liquor policy case probeIn its order discharging all the 23 accused in the excise policy scam case, including former Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal and his deputy Manish Sisodia, the Rouse Avenue Court said the prosecution narrative was speculative, legally untenable and driven by preconceived assumptions rather than evidence.

Arvind Kejriwal, Manish Sisodia cleared of charges in Delhi liquor policy case  Live UpdatesA Delhi court has cleared former Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal and former Excise Minister Manish Sisodia in the Delhi liquor policy case, ruling that the CBI had failed to substantiate its allegations. Kejriwal and Sisodia were among 23 people who were accused in the case. All have been cleared.
Earthquake tremors felt across Kolkata, people rush out of buildingsTremors were felt across Kolkata and nearby areas, with panicked residents and office workers rushing out of buildings.

Prelim probe finds no wrongdoing by Hardeep Puri in Epstein files row: SourcesThe entire episode was examined at an internal level and Puri's version was recorded in detail during the process, according to sources. Based on the preliminary findings, the government is satisfied that no objectionable or criminal involvement has emerged against the minister.

How Indraprastha became DelhiA BJP MP has demanded that New Delhi be named Indraprastha. But how did Indraprastha, associated with the Pandavas of Mahabharata, get the name Delhi? The etymological roots can be traced back to over 2,000 years ago to Raja Dhillu. Here's how India's National Capital got various names through the ages, till New Delhi stuck.

Live: Pak launches fresh strikes in Kandahar after PM Sharif's stern warning for TalibanPakistan-Afghanistan War Live Updates: Pakistan has launched Operation Ghazib Lil-haq against Afghanistan, targeting several military installations in cities like Kabul, Paktia, and Kandahar, after the border conflict between the two countries escalated on Thursday. Earlier, the Taliban administration in Afghanistan claimed that it had conquered 19 Pakistani checkposts, killing 55 soldiers in large-scale airstrikes. Catch all the live updates of the fresh tension in Indiatoday.in.

Arvind Kejriwal in tears after court clears him, says proof he's kattar imaandarAfter Arvind Kejriwal was discharged in the Delhi excise policy case due to lack of evidence, the former Delhi Chief Minister broke down before cameras as supporters gathered around him, urging him to stay strong.

Steady breaths, welled-up eyes: Lokah star Kalyani on special Virosh momentActor Kalyani Priyadarshan shared a moving moment from Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda's Udaipur wedding, and her words are hard to ignore.

Job worries, visa delays: Why Indian enrolments in US varsities fell sharply by 45%A white paper by the Graduate Management Admission Council has found that the enrolment of Indian students in US universities has fallen by at least 45%, driven by delays in obtaining student visas, as well as concerns over future employment opportunities and the political environment in the US.

But will a quick refund and bold messaging be enough to turn a damaging crisis into a chance to rebuild trust? We spoke to experts to understand what real recovery will demand.

What E20 petrol with RON 95, mandated from April 1, means for your carFrom April 1, 2026, India shifts to E20 petrol with a minimum RON 95, blending higher ethanol with premium-grade fuel. Here's what the change means for performance, efficiency and older cars.

Amma loyalist OPS pole vaults into the DMK as Stalin prepares for title defenceOPS, former AIADMK chief minister, joins DMK ahead of assembly elections. This move sets up a direct political battle with EPS and reshapes Tamil Nadu's political landscape.

Facts disregarded: Court orders action against CBI officer in Delhi liquor caseThe CBI court slammed the investigating officer for prosecuting public servants based solely on inadmissible hearsay without material evidence, calling the approach "particularly disturbing." It said the officer deliberately kept allegations "fluid," relying on statements to sustain the case while preserving the option to implicate the same individual if the prosecution failed.

Pakistan in 'open war' with Afghanistan, Minister declares as conflict escalatesTensions sharply escalated as Pakistan launched airstrikes in multiple Afghan cities targeting Taliban installations, hours after Kabul claimed cross-border attacks, marking one of the most serious flare-ups along the Durand Line.

After 20,000 layoffs, TCS CEO pushes employees to use more AI even if profits take a hitAs job worries and falling IT stocks add to the unease, TCS is asking employees to embrace AI fully and be honest with clients about cost savings, even if it hurts revenue.

Earning Rs 30 lakh a year but little wealth? Why many DINK couples fall behindWith two salaries and no childcare costs, DINK couples are often seen as having a clear financial advantage. Yet many high-earning couples find their wealth growing slower than expected. Is lifestyle inflation quietly eroding their investment potential?

Inside Tehran: Colour and culture defy the image of sanctionsThe India Today team presents a fresh perspective on life in Tehran, challenging common stereotypes about sanctioned countries. Their on-ground reporting reveals a vibrant culture and everyday normalcy amidst economic and social complexities.

Live: BJP's lust for power exposed, says wife Sunita after Arvind Kejriwal court relief Excise Policy Case Live Updates: Former Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal and former Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia have been discharged in the Delhi excise policy case, with the court ruling that the CBI failed to prove the charges against them.

The court, flagging lack of evidence against Kejriwal, said serious allegations need to be supported with material, as the attribution of a central conspiratorial role cannot be sustained without evidence. Public confidence in the office is affected if it is found that the prosecution's claims were unsupported by material, the court noted. Catch all the live updates in indiatoday.in

Neanderthal men dated human women. This shaped our DNA, study findsA new study in the journal Science reveals that interbreeding between Neanderthals and humans was strongly sex-biased. This social dynamic explains why Neanderthal DNA is missing from our X chromosome.
5-year-old falls asleep, gets locked in parked Noida school bus for 7 hoursThe incident came to light when the mother arrived to pick up her child and was told he had been marked absent in school.

Rinku Singh's father dies of liver cancer, cricketer flies home from ChennaiRinku Singh has left India's T20 World Cup camp in Chennai following the passing of his father, Khanchandra Singh. The 28-year-old has travelled to Aligarh to be with his family, with his availability for the remainder of the tournament now uncertain.

sports.headline: Chennai's chettan can wait: Sanju Samson puts CSK buzz aside for T20 World Cup T20 World Cup: Sanju Samson was thankful for the loud cheers he got in Chennai, but isn't ready to lose focus on the T20 World Cup 2026. Samson said that he is keeping the CSK excitement aside to focus on India's goal of retaining their crown.

Remembering Khanchand Singh: The father who shaped Rinku Singh's rise Rinku Singh's father, Khachandra Singh, passed away during India's T20 World Cup campaign after battling stage 4 liver cancer. The man who delivered gas cylinders in Aligarh played a defining role in shaping India's calm new-age finisher.

ENG vs NZ: Pakistan hold their breath as New Zealand chase semi-final spot T20 World Cup: Pakistan will be keeping a close eye on the contest in Colombo as New Zealand and England lock horns in the Super 8 clash on Friday, February 27. A win for the Blackcaps will seal their spot and eliminate Pakistan from the tournament.

Shivam Dube's bowling lacks confidence: Ex-India batter flags key issue T20 World Cup: Aakash Chopra warned that Shivam Dube's bowling is becoming a concern for India. Ahead of the must-win clash against West Indies, fixing the sixth bowling option could prove crucial to their semi-final hopes.

The 15-minute Masterstroke: The video that rebuilt belief in India's dressing room T20 World Cup: India bounced back strongly with a dominant batting display against Zimbabwe in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup. Following a 72-run win, Suryakumar Yadav revealed how the team management boosted their morale with a special video ahead of the fixture.

Abhishek Sharma back in form: Yuvraj's Insta story goes viral after IND vs ZIM Yuvraj Singh praised Abhishek Sharma after his first T20 World Cup fifty helped India defeat Zimbabwe by 72 runs in Chennai. Abhishek roared back to form with the sensational knock after his initial struggles in the tournament.

In breezy Chepauk, Tilak Varma found his 23-year-old self again T20 World Cup, IND Vs ZIM Super 8: Under pressure and pushed down the order, Tilak Varma rediscovered freedom in Chennai, finishing strong against Zimbabwe before soaking in the Chepauk buzz like a 23-year-old unburdened again.

No days off: Hardik, Dube's post-match bowl off leaves Sunil Gavaskar in awe T20 World Cup: Hardik Pandya and Shivam Dube decided to practise and work on their bowling right after India's win over Zimbabwe in Chennai. The work ethic and dedication from the all-rounder duo was praised by Sunil Gavaskar and Varun Aaron.

Tilak Varma unfazed by new batting role after Zimbabwe win: Will do what team needs T20 World Cup: Tilak Varma embraced a new role and delivered when India needed it most. His fearless cameo against Zimbabwe underlined his readiness to adapt for the team's cause.

Rinku Singh's father dies of liver cancer, cricketer flies home from ChennaiRinku Singh has left India's T20 World Cup camp in Chennai following the passing of his father, Khanchandra Singh. The 28-year-old has travelled to Aligarh to be with his family, with his availability for the remainder of the tournament now uncertain.

Sachin impressed with India's intent in Zimbabwe win: Take this rhythm aheadT20 World Cup: Indian cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar praised India's intent after their must-win win vs Zimbabwe. Tendulkar urged the Suryakumar Yadav-led side to carry the same rhythm into the West Indies clash, which will be a must-win for their semi-final hopes.

Abhishek Sharma finds form at the perfect time as India's semifinal push gathers paceIND vs ZIM, T20 World Cup 2026 Super 8s: Abhishek Sharma finally found his touch with a crucial 55 off 30 balls against Zimbabwe, as India posted a record 256 for four to keep their T20 World Cup semifinal hopes alive.

My dad cursed West Indies batters: Arshdeep recalls watching SA vs WI in ChennaiT20 World Cup: Between bowling India to victory and managing his father's mid-match meltdowns, Arshdeep Singh had quite the Thursday. Here, the seamer recalls the hotel room drama as he watched South Africa's clinical win over the West Indies with his father, a result that boosted India's semi-final chances.

Is Sanju playing up to the mark? Gavaskar reflects after yet another powerplay cameoIND vs ZIM, T20 World Cup 2026 Super 8s: Sanju Samson scored 24 off 15 balls against Zimbabwe but fell short of a big score. Sunil Gavaskar weighed in on whether the Kerala batter is doing enough for India in the Super 8s.

Do not take West Indies lightly: Gavaskar's on India's must-win Super 8s clashT20 World Cup 2026, Super 8s: Sunil Gavaskar has warned the Indian T20I side not to take the West Indies lightly. Both teams are set to meet in a must-win game where a spot in the semis is at stake in Kolkata.

England haven't played a perfect game but still found ways to win: Tim SoutheeT20 World Cup, England vs New Zealand: England's bowling coach Tim Southee is delighted that their team hasn't played a perfect game but has still ended up on a winning side.

Aiden Markram cautious despite South Africa's unbeaten run: Can't take things for grantedT20 World Cup 2026, SA vs WI: Aiden Markram said that South Africa can't take things for granted despite their unbeaten run in the tournament. On Thursday, the Proteas beat West Indies by nine wickets after which India's win over Zimbabwe helped them qualify for the semis.

West Indies will look to turn things around quickly against India: Shai HopeT20 World Cup, WI vs SA: Speaking to the reporters after the nine-wicket loss to South Africa, Shai Hope said that West Indies will look to bounce back when they face India in their must-win clash at the Eden Gardens in Kolkata.

Arshdeep Singh breaks Jasprit Bumrah's major record with 3-wicket haul vs ZimbabweArshdeep Singh became India's highest wicket-taker in T20 World Cup history during the Super 8 match against Zimbabwe. His record-breaking performance helped India secure a dominant 72-run victory and strengthened their semi-final hopes.

IND vs ZIM: Avengers Assemble in Chennai as India storm back into semifinal raceIND vs ZIM, T20 World Cup Super 8: Forget solo acts. India's ensemble cast turned up the heat at Chepauk, plundering a record 256 to outclass Zimbabwe and reignite their T20 World Cup dreams in Chennai. Brian Bennett's valiant 97 went in vain as Zimbabwe lost by 72 runs.

Zimbabwe conquered. How can India qualify for T20 World Cup semis? ExplainedT20 World Cup, IND vs ZIM: Suryakumar Yadav's India defeated Zimbabwe by 72 runs at the MA Chidambaram Stadium on Thursday and will next face the West Indies on March 1 in a bid to secure a place in the semifinals.

Jos Buttler's form a concern? Tim Southee backs England batter amid horrid formT20 World Cup, NZ vs ENG: Tim Southee has backed Jos Buttler to bounce back when England lock horns with New Zealand in their last Super 8 game on Friday in Colombo.

IND vs ZIM: Abhishek Sharma puts form woes behind him with sizzling fifty in ChennaiIND vs ZIM: Abhishek Sharma silenced his critics with a patient and measured 55 off 30 balls against Zimbabwe at Chepauk, earning a standing ovation from the Chennai crowd in the T20 World Cup Super 8s.

IND vs ZIM: Samson gets roaring Chepauk welcome, Axar return ends Sundar experimentIND vs ZIM, T20 World Cup 2026: Chepauk gave Sanju Samson a roaring welcome as vice-captain Axar Patel's return brought Washington Sundar's brief experiment in the XI to an abrupt end.

New Zealand don't want to leave semifinal hopes on external factors: Rob WalterT20 World Cup 2026, NZ vs ENG: Speaking to the reporters, New Zealand coach Rob Walter said that the Black Caps don't want to leave their semi-final hopes to external factors when they face England on Friday.

South Africa help India, hammer West Indies to keep semifinal race spicyT20 World Cup, SA vs WI: South Africa defeated West Indies by nine wickets on Thursday at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad, also giving India a boost in their race to qualify for the semifinals.

Do it the Auqib Nabi way: J&K star shows how you can also knock on India's doorsFrom hilly terrains in Baramulla to the top of India's domestic bowling charts, Auqib Nabi Dar's journey is a masterclass in chasing small wins until the biggest one arrives.

J&K eye big lead despite Mayank's hundred for Karnataka on Day 3Jammu and Kashmir remained firmly in control of the Ranji Trophy final at stumps on Day 3, even as Mayank Agarwal produced the knock of rare grit and character to keep Karnataka afloat. The hosts ended the day on 220 for 5, still trailing J&K's imposing first-innings total of 584, with Mayank unbeaten on 130 in a lone battle of defiance.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
